title: I Tried Amazon KDP For 30 Days… Here’s How Much I Made

tactics.name: Sub-Niche Focus
tactics.description: Prioritize specific sub-niches to avoid competition and leverage targeted audiences.
steps: Upload 3 books/day initially due to KDP's spam prevention limit
Wait 30 days for organic ranking before expecting sales
Publish 7+ books in a single niche to build momentum
caveats: Competition spikes when niche becomes popular
source_quotes: 'You need to go into sub niches... you can't just create big general things'

tactics.name: underserved_niche_research
tactics.description: Identify niches with high search volume and low competition using Amazon search data tools
steps: Use Book Bolt to gather Amazon search data
Check monthly search volume and estimated sales
source_quotes: You can't just create big general things on marketplaces... competing with a ton of people.

heuristics.name: competition_score_heuristic
heuristics.condition: If competition score is A-rated then prioritize
source_quotes: This is an underserved niche because it has an A-rated competition score.

claims.statement: KDP accounts require 30+ days of organic ranking before generating measurable sales
source_quotes: 'we only actually got one sale' in first 30 days

claims.statement: General product categories like blank notebooks face high competition on Amazon
source_quotes: Everyone else who's a seller on that platform has already thought of that idea...

niche_patterns.example: word search puzzles + educational needs + niche audience
niche_patterns.description: Target specific sub-niches with low competition and high search volume
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Reduces competition while maintaining search visibility
source_quotes: 'this is just such a strong niche'

niche_patterns.description: Combine specific geographic themes with popular product formats
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Creates unique intersections with low existing competition
source_quotes: Alaska-themed word searches... almost 4,000 people per month searching
